text: Plattsburgh State University of New York
Dr. Alexander Enyedi, Our New President
We are a liberal arts college offering more than 70 academic programs in humanities, science, education, and more - including hard-to-find degrees like Expeditionary Studies and Robotics.

Be prepared to adapt to the continual shifts in new technologies and challenges to our health and planet. Our rigorous liberal arts education and strong base in genetics, biochemistry, physiology, microbiology and ecology gives you the experience you need for a successful career.

Prepare for an exciting career in the growing field of TV and video. With numerous hands-on learning opportunities and top-notch facilities, you'll acquire the skills you need. Plus, you'll have access to our on-campus television station!

Studying abroad is an incredible opportunity that will help you develop personally, professionally and culturally. SUNY Plattsburgh offers 500  locations worldwide and 200  locations within the U.S. Our programs are flexible and financial aid may be available to you!
The professors are all willing to go above and beyond to help you with anything you need; whether it is homework help, test prep, career advice or networking.
SUNY Plattsburgh laid the groundwork for me to grow as a student and as a person.
I feel so fortunate to have had the opportunity to study at SUNY Plattsburgh. The school offers us the opportunities to dive into many interesting, diverse areas.
With countless ways to get involved, including more than 90 clubs and Greek Life organizations, it's easy to find where you'll fit in as part of our campus community.

Plattsburgh State University of New York
One Visit to Campus and You'll Know
Why SUNY Plattsburgh? Honestly, we think one visit to campus and you'll know the answer right away.
Challenging programs, supportive professors and all the resources you need to succeed.
Plattsburgh is nestled at the foothills of the beautiful Adirondacks and the shores  of Lake Champlain.
Prepare for your future with internship assistance, career counseling and 1:1 academic advising.

Why SUNY Plattsburgh? There are numerous reasons. From professors who are leaders in their field, to hands-on learning through undergraduate research, study abroad, internships and more – SUNY Plattsburgh will jump-start your career.

Situated in one of the world's most beautiful regions - on Lake Champlain near the Adirondacks - Plattsburgh is the ideal location for anything outdoors. And, when it's time to explore, we're close to interesting places like Montreal, Lake Placid and Burlington, VT.

Named one of U.S. News and World Report's "America's Best Colleges", SUNY Plattsburgh is deeply committed to academic excellence. Our 1,100 freshmen choose from 60  high-quality, affordable degree programs.
Campus activities abound in a residential, seven-day-a-week atmosphere. Live and learn within a safe and vibrant campus situated in one of New York's most scenic locations.

SUNY Plattsburgh enrolls over 500 transfer students annually and is committed to making the transfer process easy. We have a friendly credit-transfer policy, and we'll pre-register you into your major courses before orientation. Additionally, our branch campus in Queensbury offers students in the greater Glens Falls/Saratoga region the convenience of a high-quality education in their own backyard.
Of Faculty Hold the Highest Degree

Graduate study programs at SUNY Plattsburgh will strengthen your knowledge, character, and leadership skills as you work to broaden your professional abilities and achieve your career objectives. Study and work side by side with dedicated faculty to enhance your credentials and explore the unique career opportunities available to you.

Our diverse college community attracts international students from more than 60 countries. We invite you to discover the opportunities for hands-on learning alongside top-notch faculty, generous scholarship packages available to you as an international student, and caring staff who will guide you on every step of your journey here at SUNY Plattsburgh.
Take that first step toward your future and see for yourself why SUNY Plattsburgh is everything you want in a college experience.

On campus, you can get involved with one of our many clubs and organizations, see a concert or catch a Cardinals game. Off campus, you can visit restaurants, shopping centers, catch a movie or a show!

Our commitment to professional preparation is what we are known for, with endless opportunities for hands-on experience through clinical and professional practice. Small classes and dedicated faculty offer the ability to grow in a close-knit, supportive environment.

Get Started On Your Application for Graduate Admission
Read these instructions carefully before submitting your application.
Go back to the SUNY Plattsburgh Home Page

Applications to all graduate programs at SUNY Plattsburgh and the branch campus at ACC in Queensbury are processed by the Graduate Admissions Office, located in the Kehoe Administration Building in Plattsburgh, New York.
The online application form must be completed in one sitting (usually 10–15 minutes).
Before starting the application, be prepared to provide:
Approximate dates of all colleges attended
Names of anyone sending letters of recommendation on your behalf
It is the applicant’s responsibility to contact recommenders and provide any required recommendation
The application fee can only be paid after your application has been processed. You’ll receive instructions on how to do so on

Upon submission of the application form, within 2–3 business days, you will receive a list of additional application items required to complete your application. Be sure to submit all items in a timely manner for full admission consideration.
Already have a SUNY Plattsburgh NetID?
and click on the link to the Graduate Admission Application under Current Announcements. By logging in this way, your basic contact information will be pre-populated for you.
One of the following preparatory worksheets:
All official transcripts from prior institutions, showing a 3.0 or higher cumulative undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale

All official transcripts from prior institutions, showing a 2.8 or higher cumulative undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale, and at least 12 credit hours of coursework in psychology, human service, education or a related field
All official transcripts from prior institutions
An interview with faculty, to be scheduled by the department
All official transcripts from prior institutions, showing a 2.5 or higher
All official transcripts from prior institutions, showing a bachelor’s degree in a science discipline with a 3.0 or higher cumulative undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale
A copy of NYS Permanent or Professional Teaching Certificate
All official transcripts from prior institutions, showing a 3.0 or higher cumulative graduate GPA on a 4.0 scale
A copy of NYS SBL Certification and Teaching Certificate

All official transcripts from prior institutions, showing a 3.0 or higher cumulative undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale, and at least 12 credit hours of undergraduate coursework in psychology, human services, education or a closely related area.

Undergraduate coursework in experimental psychology and statistical analysis, clinical/abnormal, cognitive and development. An undergraduate course in psychological assessment or tests and measurement is recommended, but not required.
Evidence of experience working with school populations: job experience, volunteer work, course assignments, tutoring, teaching, camp counseling or other appropriate experiences.

Documentation of a current New York State Teaching Certificate, or a written explanation indicating how all NYSED eligibility requirements for a New York State Teaching Certificate (including NYSTCE exams, SAVE, DASA, and other) will be completed prior to matriculation into the certificate program.

Evidence of a 3.0 graduate GPA (as shown on the graduate transcript) for individuals with a master’s degree or evidence of a 3.0 undergraduate GPA (as shown on the undergraduate transcript) for individuals with a bachelor’s degree accompanied by satisfactory performance on a national graduate admissions exam (GRE score 260 or better, or MAT score 200 or better).

Evidence (as shown in transcripts) of appropriate general education core and content core that includes 6 credit hours each of English Language Arts, Concepts in Historical and Social Sciences, Scientific Processes, and Mathematical Processes, as well as 6 credits of teaching literacy skills to both native speakers and English Language Learners.
A Statement of Purpose indicating why you want to enter this specific program.
Attendance at an on-campus interview, if requested.
A copy of NYS Initial Teaching Certificate (not required for Generalist 7–12 program)

Find Your Pathway and Begin the Process
If you are a student who has previously matriculated and wishes to re-enter, you must apply for readmission in order to re-enroll.
Students who are applying to the Educational Opportunity Program (EOP) should reference the EOP Admissions Process to be sure all materials are submitted.
If you are a student with military-affiliations, please be sure to check out the resources available to you through the Veterans Support Office.
